alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Laurens; Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 4:03AM EDT until April 03 at 9:42PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River at GA 26 near Montezuma affecting Dooly, Sumter and Macon Counties. Ocmulgee River at US 341 at Hawkinsville affecting Pulaski and Bleckley Counties. Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Wilcox, Dodge and Telfair Counties. Oconee River at Dublin affecting Washington, Johnson, Laurens and Wilkinson Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Washington, Johnson and Wilkinson Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Griffin, Juliette, Juliette, Dames Ferry, Macon, Macon, Hawkinsville, Byron, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Oconee River at Dublin. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 27 feet, Significant flooding expands into the woodlands and agricutural areas upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 80. The flood waters will be around 4 feet deep on Rex Miller Road and Old River Lane. Several homes on these roads will be under two feet of water. Also a few homes on River Ridge Road will be flooded with a foot of water. Portions of the Riverview Park Golf Course will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM EDT Friday the stage was 26.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 AM EDT Friday was 26.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 21 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.2 feet on 10/05/1989. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
